Content: Hippie!

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: the addresses that you see for BTC, KMD and all other BTC forks, they are almost all in base58check format

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: some new kinds of addresses are different, but don't worry about that for now

Author: GlorymanRTS#0512
Content: Is base 58 just as it sounds

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: base58 is one thing, and then base58check is that plus a checksum

Author: GlorymanRTS#0512
Content: It's a count upto 58 and then that's recorded as another digit to the left of the single digit.

Author: GlorymanRTS#0512
Content: Oh, want a checksum?

Author: GlorymanRTS#0512
Content: What

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: binary is base 2, octal is base 8, hex is base 16, and base58 is base 58

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: cryptography and hash functions are discrete math, not continuous

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: but many concepts still apply

Content: Yeah, I wanted to get that book on discrete maths, the same guy that wrote the art of programming.

Content: difference equations are the equivalent of differential equations, with discrete variables

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: Donald Knuth

Author: GlorymanRTS#0512
Content: Yeah, u know him

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: it's one of the most important CS books, but it's also not easy to read üòÉ I think I own them and read some parts, they are like encyclopedia's

Content: I've been relearning some of my uni maths and some computer science. Hopefully, it will help me in programming komodo and maybe fpgas

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: you need to understand hash functions to understand cryptocoins, like MD5, SHA1, SHA256 etc..

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: there are many, but understand the basics that they all share

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: linear algebra and vector/tensor analysis will be helpful for FPGAs

Content: Yeah, I will. I'm really looking forward to the new year when my books arrive.

Content: theory of signal processing as well

Author: GlorymanRTS#0512
Content: Sweet. I'm going to take note of all this.

Content: FPGAs allow you to operate on large buckets of data at the same time, so everything is vectorized/matrix format

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: FPGAs have their own kinds of programming language as well

Author: SuSC135#6248
Content: for testing a smart contract . should I create a new asset chain on my system and then try to query it with my existing asset chain? Or should I create a new asset chain in a different system and try to communicate with it? How should I proceed?

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @SuSC135 either option, also regtest mode is an option

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: there must be some nodes running, maybe at least 2 sometimes, which know about your CC contract

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: spin up locally and talk to it via localhost is probably what you want

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: regtest mode makes it so mining blocks is very easy, it's for testing locally

Author: SuSC135#6248
Content: By testing I mean i want to create an application like a payment gateway using channel contract

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: you can also test on KMD labs if the current assetchains have the params you need

Author: SuSC135#6248
Content: I have created a channel contract. And when I am trying to do a channel open I get an error. The error doesn't give lot of information . Where am I going wrong

Author: SuSC135#6248
TonyL#3577
Content: @SuSC135 Could you restart `-ac_name=ChannelTest` daemon with `--daemon` param to see the daemon output and try again?

Author: TonyL#3577
Content:
Regards your previous question about best CC testing environment:
I think it's a best idea to spin own chain to not depends on someones updates and not guess if other nodes have same software versions when testing. It's super easy to spinoff chain so I don't see any reasons to not do it in private tests.

Author: SuSC135#6248
Content: yes I did spin up two different asset chains in my own system. with different port numbers and I am trying to open a channel between them.

Author: SuSC135#6248
Content: now I am getting this error

Author: SuSC135#6248
Content:
``error code: -1
error message:
to use CC contracts, you need to launch daemon with valid -pubkey= for an address in your wallet``

Author: SuSC135#6248
Content: Here I have given pubkey of first assest chain

Author: TonyL#3577
Content:
Aha, so actually this error means what it types: 
1) you have to get a pubkey on your assetchain for each node. Like a 
```./komodo-cli -ac_name=ChannelTest getaccountaddress ""
./komodo-cli -ac_name=ChannelTest validateaddress address^^```

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: 2) stop daemon and restart with -pubkey= param with pubkey which you get from actions above (other words pubkey valid for this wallet)

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: ```./komodod -ac_name=ChannelTest otherparams... -pubkey=pubkeyfromvalidateaddressoutput ...  ```

Author: SuSC135#6248
Content: So let me get this right.. I have two asset chains KMDICE and ChannelTest.  And  I gave the pubkey of KMDice as a destination address in channelsopen of  ChannelTest asset chain

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: what?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: channels is not cross chain

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: You have to open channel between pubkeys on the same chain

Author: SuSC135#6248
Content: Oh!! ok . So  I should have the address present in the same wallet of  a single chain. I get it now. Thank You

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: Destination pubkey may be related to any other wallet but on the same chain. And to be able to interact with CC by assetchain daemon you have to start it with valid -pubkey= for an address in your wallet

I went through your documents yesterday and I feel did something wrong  in the way I created and validated my address. I am still getiing the same kind of error ``error code: -1
error message:
to use CC contracts, you need to launch daemon with valid -pubkey= for an address in your wallet``

Author: SuSC135#6248
Content: These are the steps I used to create the asset chain and try to open the channel. Is there something wrong with this?

Author: SuSC135#6248
Content:
``komodod.exe -ac_name=ChannelTest -ac_supply=10500000 -ac_reward=2500000000 -ac_halving=210000 -ac_perc=10000000  -ac_cc=2 -addressindex=1 -spentindex=1  &
komodo-cli.exe getnewaddress
komodo-cli validateaddress <myaddress>
komodod.exe -ac_name=ChannelTest -ac_supply=10500000 -ac_reward=2500000000 -ac_halving=210000 -ac_perc=10000000  -ac_cc=2 -addressindex=1 -spentindex=1 -pubkey=<mypubkey> & 
komodo-cli.exe getnewaddress 
komodo-cli validateaddress <myaddress2>
komodo-cli.exe -ac_name=ChannelTest channelsopen <mypubkeyaddress2> 1 100``

Author: TonyL#3577
Content:
@SuSC135 You've missed one important detail:
```
komodo-cli.exe -ac_name=ChannelTest getnewaddress
komodo-cli.exe -ac_name=ChannelTest validateaddress <myaddress>```

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: valid -pubkey= for an address in your wallet - on assetchain for which you starting the daemon, not KMD chain

Author: SuSC135#6248
Content: yes i am sorry i did it on the asset chain only... I made a mistake in typing the command

Author: SuSC135#6248
Content: i did all of this on the  asset chain itself

./komodo-cli -ac_name=TONY7 validateaddress RJ8cuSGzBEVr7mD988tPVdMvTy2kgieJr6

Author: TonyL#3577
Content:
Then I stop the daemon:
`./komodo-cli -ac_name=TONY7 stop`

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: ```./komodod -ac_name=TONY7 -ac_supply=5555555 -ac_reward=10000000000000 -ac_cc=2 -addressindex=1 -spentindex=1 -addnode=159.69.201.122 -pubkey= 02b51b0df36eee30393c698814a0cbb0096a78509200d5b69f9756892f61d56e93 --daemon```

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: And start it with valid pubkey for my wallet

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: Could you please try to do this actions sequence again @SuSC135  ?

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: If you have 2 daemons and run one of them with correct pubkey - maybe you're issuing CC RPC calls on the second one which started without correct -pubkey param. Just an assumption
